sci.crayfis.shramp.analysis

Class Histogram

  • java.lang.Object
    • sci.crayfis.shramp.analysis.Histogram

  • public class Histogram
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a histogram and related functions

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Histogram(int low, int high)
      Creates a new histogram from low to high in integer pixel steps

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int add(double value)
      Add the value to the histogram
      double getBinCenter(int bin) 
      int getBinNumber(double value) 
      int getMaxBin() 
      double getMaxStdDev() 
      int getValue(int bin) 
      void reset()
      Resets (clears) histogram values including overflow/underflow but keeps the same bins

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Histogram

        public Histogram(int low,
                 int high)
        Creates a new histogram from low to high in integer pixel steps
        Parameters:
        low - Low limit in pixel value units
        high - High limit in pixel value units

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public int add(double value)
        Add the value to the histogram
        Parameters:
        value - Value to add
        Returns:
        The bin number it was added to, -1 = underflow, Nbins = overflow

      • getBinCenter

        public double getBinCenter(int bin)
        Parameters:
        bin - Bin number
        Returns:
        The value for the center of the bin, Double.NaN if bin number is beyond [0, nBins - 1]

      • getBinNumber

        public int getBinNumber(double value)
        Parameters:
        value - Value to find the bin number
        Returns:
        The bin number where value lies, -1 if underflow, Nbins if overflow

      • getMaxBin

        public int getMaxBin()
        Returns:
        The bin number where the maximum histogram value is, if there are more than one equal maximum, returns the first occurrence (does not search underflow/overflow bins)

      • getMaxStdDev

        public double getMaxStdDev()
        Returns:
        The standard deviation immediately surrounding the max bin (+/- 10 pixel values)

      • getValue

        public int getValue(int bin)
        Parameters:
        bin - Bin number for the histogram value wanted
        Returns:
        The value at that bin (bin number = -1 is underflow, = Nbins is overflow)

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets (clears) histogram values including overflow/underflow but keeps the same bins
